ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Presbycusis and Genetic Hearing Loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Bilateral loss with family history; mixed component and asymmetry present but retrocochlear pathology ruled out by MRI.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Retrocochlear Pathology
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Considered due to asymmetric hearing loss and abnormal ABR, but ruled out by normal MRI.

ordered_list.rationale_short: Standard assessment to determine degree, type, and configuration of hearing loss.
Assess speech reception thresholds and word recognition abilities.
Evaluate middle ear function and rule out conductive pathology.
Assess integrity of the reflex arc and screen for retrocochlear pathology.
Investigate asymmetric hearing loss to screen for retrocochlear pathology.
Definitive imaging ordered due to abnormal ABR results.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient presents with bilateral asymmetric hearing loss. The right ear shows a high-frequency sensorineural loss, while the left ear exhibits a mixed loss with air-bone gaps in low and high frequencies, despite normal tympanograms and acoustic reflexes. Speech recognition is excellent in the right ear and good in the left. Due to the asymmetry, an ABR was performed and found abnormal, leading to an MRI which was normal, ruling out retrocochlear pathology.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Normal (250-2000 Hz) sloping to moderately severe SNHL at 8000 Hz. Left ear: Mixed loss; moderately severe to mild in lows (250-500 Hz), rising to normal in mids, sloping to moderately severe mixed in highs.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: SRT 12 dB, WRS 96%. Left ear: SRT 25 dB, WRS 80%.

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Normal ipsilateral and contralateral thresholds (500-4000 Hz); negative decay.

counseling_actions: Explain the asymmetric and mixed nature of the hearing loss
Discuss ABR and MRI results confirming no retrocochlear pathology
Counsel on realistic expectations for hearing aids in background noise

escalation.rationale_short: Referral required for medical evaluation of asymmetric hearing loss and abnormal ABR results.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor hearing thresholds and hearing aid benefit due to complex nature of loss.

expected_outcome: ABR results were abnormal, prompting further medical investigation.
MRI was normal, ruling out retrocochlear pathology.
Patient was medically cleared and obtained bilateral hearing aids.
